intro: Zehneria hermaphrodita, commonly known as the golden star, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow flowers with a distinctive star-shaped pattern. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Zehneria hermaphrodita is a perennial shrub that can grow up to 1.5 meters tall, with lance-shaped leaves and hairy stems.
